titleStmt.title: James W. Daniel to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6621

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Cromwell Ky June, 19th 1865
Hon Thomas E Bramlet
Govenor of Ky

Sir please find petition and a copy of fines agst me from the best men in our county I Recd a letter from the auditor stating that I must send two dollars to each indictment which you will find enclosed let me say to you that the men that appeard agst me was men that fellout with me for the very Reason that I voted as I thought for the benefit of my country and if I had to vote again I would do the Same as the very word Rebel is offensive to me I am very poor and have a family of four children and they are all Girls and I cannot pay the fine unless I can get help please Remit it and I will never deal in the article any
more So I Sincerely ask you to Remit my fines

I am your obedient Servt
James,, W,, Daniel

please have the letter directed to me at Cromwell
Ky
care of,, P,, M
